hackathon-description-text: The America East hackathon, Hack AE, is a 24-hour civic hackathon organized by the America East Academic Consortium, the academic initiative of the America East Conference. Hack AE is designed to provide undergraduate developers and designers who are enrolled at America East Conference member universities with a unique opportunity to build software and hardware projects that encourage civic engagement and/or address the real-world challenges facing our cities, states, and country.
hackathon-eligibility: Undergraduate students who are enrolled at an America East Conference member university may register to attend. America East Conference member universities are as follows:
hackathon-requirements:
Hackers may build anything (e.g., web applications, desktop applications, mobile applications, hardware) provided the project: (1) strives to foster civic engagement; or (2) seeks to address an issue of considerable importance to our society. 
Projects may not contain anything that is or may be construed as: (1) threatening, harassing, degrading or hateful; (2) defamatory; (3) fraudulent; or (4) obsence, indecent, or otherwise objectionable. Further, projects may not contain any material that may encourage conduct constituting a criminal offense.
hackathon-rules:
Hackers may build anything (e.g., web applications, desktop applications, mobile applications, hardware) provided the project: (1) strives to foster civic engagement; or (2) seeks to address an issue of considerable importance to our society.
Projects may not contain anything that is or may be construed as: (1) threatening, harassing, degrading, or hateful; (2) defamatory; (3) fraudulent; of (4) obsence, indecent, or otherwise objectionable. Further, projects may not contain any material that may encourage conduct constituting a criminal offense. 
Additionally, please note that Hack AE is proud to be a Major League Hacking partner event. All participants must abide by the 
.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment. Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Win a HackHarassment Swag Bag.

Everything is part of the internet of things now - from your phone to your fitness band to your thermostat. Build a hack that utilizes private data being collected from your devices, and show how you can turn potential vulnerabilities into something constructive. Prize: Collector's Edition of Watch Dogs 2
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Watch Dogs® 2 Best Device Privacy Hack
Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best hack by a first-time hacker
Hack that requires most technical insight and problem-solving knowledge
Hack with greatest impact in the area of health and wellness
Hack that solves a problem in an unconventional way
Hack that makes best use of digital media (video, pictures, games, ect.)

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=85 Murray Hill Rd, Vestal, NY 13850, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the solution unique and innovative? Does the project do something entirely novel or take a fresh approach to an old problem?
Is the project technically advanced? Did the students solve a difficulty technical problem in completing the project?
Is the project usable in its current state? Is the user experience smooth? Is the project aesthetically pleasing?
Is the project something that people are likely to use? Does the project fulfill a real need? Is the project likely to have a positive impact in our local community, region, nation, or world?

hackathon-location-address: 85 Murray Hill Rd, Vestal, NY 13850, USA
hackathon-description-header: Hack AE is a civic hackathon designed to provide America East undergraduate students with the opportunity to build software and hardware projects that positively impact the world around them.
